授業目的: The course will be a basic introduction into the theory and practice of international relations. Students will learn concepts, definitions and dimensions of international relations studies and acquire analytical skills to navigate today's world's complex international relations.
到達目標:
- Acquire knowledge of the international relations field (theories, key events)
- Develop analytical skills relevant to understand international relations and past and current world events
- Develop critical thinking needed to understand and assess various past and present international relations developments and events from different perspectives incl. from the point of view of Japan
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
関連科目: foreign policy, political science, global affairs, United Nations/international organizations
授業の概要・背景: This introductory course will teach about basic definitions and theories in the field of international relations and apply them to review historical and present IR developments and events.
授業方法: This course will be conducted as a mix of lecture and interaction (seminar/discussion) format. Typically, the topics of each session will be introduced in lecture format (30-40 minutes) and further developed through Q&A/discussions and group work by the students.

第1回:
Introduction of the course, its scope, basic outline, key concepts and definitions
This session will also explain the learning goals and course flow including expectations for the students' own course work (mini-research on case study topics chosen by the students)
post-session homework (reading assignment will be announced at the session) - time required max. 1 hour
第2回: post-session homework (reading assignment will be announced at the session) - time required max. 1 hour
第3回:
International Relations Theory:
Realist and Liberal Approaches to International Relations (1)
post-session homework (reading assignment will be announced at the session) - time required max. 1 hour
第4回:
International Relations Theory:
Realist and Liberal Approaches to International Relations (2)
students will pick their case study topics for mini-research (the research findings will be presented in sessions 10-13 and lead to the submission of a final paper at the end of the course)
第5回:
International Relations Theory:
Wrap of the IR Theory introductions (remaining issues from sessions 1-4), Q&A, discussions, examples/case studies

post-session homework (reading assignment) - time required max. 1 hour
students will also finalise their choice of case study topic
第6回: Mid-Term Recap with Practical Examples from Current International Relations (examples: Japan’s diplomatic efforts to realize FOIP, US/China/Taiwan crisis, Ukraine situation, BRICS or other examples chosen by the students)
post-session homework (reading assignment will be announced at the session); students will submit feedback on the reading in writing  - time required max. 1.5 hours
第7回: The Multiple Dimensions of International Relations - political and ideological divides, IR geography, the military dimension, cooperation vs. competition, interplay between foreign and domestic policy
post-session homework (reading assignment will be announced at the session) - time required max. 1 hour
第8回: Understanding International Politics and Foreign Policy: Levels of Analysis Part 1
post-session homework (reading assignment will be announced at the session); students will submit feedback on the reading in writing  - time required max. 1.5 hours
第9回: Understanding International Politics and Foreign Policy: Levels of Analysis Part 2
post-session homework (reading assignment will be announced at the session) - time required max. 1 hour
第10回: Case Study 1: World Wars 1+2 from an International Relations Perspective
brief feedback on the student presentation(s) of the session - time required 0.5 hours
第11回: Case Study 2: The Cold War 1950s-1990s incl. Cuban missile crisis, Vietnam War, Afghanistan
brief feedback on the student presentation(s) of the session - time required 0.5 hours
第12回: Case Study 3: The Emergence of China - Shift in World Politics
brief feedback on the student presentation(s) of the session - time required 0.5 hours
第13回: Case Study 4: Diplomacy around Today's Global Issues (Climate Change, Global Health, Human Rights, Displacement, Poverty etc.)
brief feedback on the student presentation(s) of the session - time required 0.5 hours
第14回:
Course Conclusion:
The State of International Relations Today ... and Tomorrow
The deadline for the submission of the final paper will be announced in early June.
